title: How to Clean Inside a Laptop Computer

steps.title: Make sure the laptop is switched off and take the battery out.
steps.content: Make sure the laptop is switched off and take the battery out.

steps.title: Unscrew only the screws relevant for the particular part of the laptop you are trying to disassemble.
steps.content: Unscrew only the screws relevant for the particular part of the laptop you are trying to disassemble. There are signs engraved right under or beside the screw as a guide.

steps.title: Take all the relevant screws out.
steps.content: Take all the relevant screws out.

steps.title: Gently remove the touch pad portion and disconnect its wire from the laptop.
steps.content: Gently remove the touch pad portion and disconnect its wire from the laptop.

steps.title: Gently lift the keyboard and also disconnect it from the laptop.
steps.content: Gently lift the keyboard and also disconnect it from the laptop.

steps.title: Take your can of compressed air and spray all over the laptop.
steps.content: Take your can of compressed air and spray all over the laptop. Concentrate the most on the fan, processor and memory. You should always keep the compressed air at a 90-degree angle upwards. If you turn it in any direction and orientation, the compressed air will actually spit out the hydrogen and it will turn into ice. Get a strong nozzle to pinpoint the direction that the air is coming out of, always aiming it into open vent ports.

steps.title: Review the results.
steps.content: Review the results. Once done, the inside of a laptop should look like this.

steps.title: Put everything back the way it was.
steps.content: Put everything back the way it was. Make sure you gently press the connector of a keyboard to connect it to the laptop as well as the touch pad.

steps.title: Screw again the back of a laptop in the same order.
steps.content: Screw again the back of a laptop in the same order.
